author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Ireland’s finance ministry must better balance income and expenditure to protect public finances from global trade turmoil, the country’s biggest business lobbyist said.
title: Ireland’s Next Budget Must Be Prudent, Business Lobby Warns

author: Gregory Korte
description: For decades, presidents have used autopens to keep up with the relentless stream of paperwork that crosses their desk. But it’s not just a matter of saving them from hand cramps. When the president is traveling, time-sensitive documents – such as bills to keep the government open – may need a signature right away, and it’s not always feasible to fly the original documents to wherever the president is.
title: Why Trump Is Attacking Biden Over Autopen Signatures

author: John Liu, Bei Hu, Dingmin Zhang
description: Chinese quantitative hedge funds are stepping up efforts to hire science and engineering students in the US affected by President Donald Trump’s university funding cuts and tighter visa policies.
title: China’s Quant Funds Boost US Recruiting After Trump’s Visa Curbs

author: Maho Nambu, Reina Sasaki, Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s Liberal Democratic Party has dominated the country for the last 70 years, losing control of the government only twice. A five-year-old party cobbled together on social media during the pandemic is trying to weaken that grip on power by tapping into voter frustrations and anti-foreigner sentiment.
title: Fringe Party Vows to Put ‘Japan First’ to Chip Away at LDP Rule

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The US Commerce Department launched investigations into imports of drones, parts for unmanned aerial vehicles and for polysilicon, a key material for solar power, setting the stage for possible tariffs on those goods.
title: Trump Launches Investigation of Drones, Setting Stage for Tariffs

author: Hadriana Lowenkron
description: The Trump Administration withdrew from a longstanding trade agreement with Mexico governing the import of tomatoes and will push forward with a new tariff of just over 17%, the Commerce Department announced Monday.
title: Trump Moves to Impose 17% Tariff on Most Mexican Tomato Imports

author: Anthony Capaccio
description: Lockheed Martin Corp. has delivered F-35 jets parked at its Forth Worth, Texas plant to the US government as of May 1 after several months of delay due to late software improvements, according to the Pentagon’s program office.
title: Lockheed Clears 72-Jet Backlog of F-35s Parked Over Late Software Improvements

author: Sherif Tarek
description: Israel launched attacks in southern Syria on Monday after deadly clashes that involved the Druze community, a minority group that the Jewish state has pledged to protect.
title: Israel Strikes Syria After New Clashes Involving Druze Minority

author: Ryan Chua
description: Democrats on the Senate Foreign Relations Committee accused the Trump administration of “ceding global leadership to China,” citing the trade war and a retreat from international engagement through cuts to foreign aid and media agencies.
title: Senate Democrats Say Trump ‘Ceding Global Leadership’ to China

author: Nathan R Dean
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Monday, Bloomberg Intelligence senior analyst Nathan Dean gives his insights into what’s been happening and what’s coming up in the nooks and crannies of government and markets.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Crypto Week Cranks Up in Congress With Stablecoin Vote

author: Michael Nienaber
description: Germany has asked the Trump administration to make two more Patriot missile batteries available for Ukraine, Defense Minister Boris Pistorius said, as allied nations look to repel Russia’s stepped-up missile and drone campaign.
title: Germany Seeks Two More Patriot Missile Batteries for Ukraine

author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided US Supreme Court let President Donald Trump resume dismantling the Department of Education, lifting a lower court order that required the reinstatement of as many as 1,400 workers.
title: Supreme Court Lets Trump Continue Education Department Purge

author: Matthew Griffin, Georgie McKay
description: For years, investors have found themselves at the whim of President Donald Trump’s social-media posts. Now, traders are being forced to pay attention to an unlikely official: Federal Housing Finance Agency head Bill Pulte.
title: Pulte’s Social Media Posts Become Must-Follow for Stock Traders

author: Laura Nahmias
description: Andrew Cuomo said he plans to remain in the race for New York City mayor, brushing off calls to step aside after his shocking loss to upstart Zohran Mamdani in the Democratic primary.
title: Cuomo Says He’ll Contest NYC Mayoral Race to Challenge Mamdani

author: Jim Wyss
description: Cuba’s crucial and struggling tourism industry was hit with more US sanctions, as President Donald Trump’s administration ratchets up pressure on the communist-run island and its top officials.
title: Trump Piles Fresh Sanctions on Cuba’s Flailing Tourism Industry

author: Jackie Davalos
description: Four of the top US artificial intelligence developers won contracts from the Defense Department aimed at accelerating the military’s adoption of the emerging technology.
title: Pentagon Awards Up to $200 Million in Contracts to xAI, OpenAI

author: Skylar Woodhouse, Stephanie Lai, Ari Natter
description: President Donald Trump will announce $70 billion in artificial intelligence and energy investments in Pennsylvania on Tuesday, the latest push from the White House to speed up development of the emerging technology.
title: Trump to Unveil $70 Billion in AI and Energy Investments

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy, Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump indicated he is open to more trade negotiations, including with the European Union, even as he insisted that his letters threatening new tariff rates are “the deals” for US trading partners.
title: Trump Says He’s Open to Tariff Talks With EU After Threatening 30% Levy

author: Irina Vilcu
description: Romania’s government survived a no-confidence motion on Monday, clearing the way for a sweeping austerity plan aimed at scaling back a budget deficit that’s become the widest in the European Union.
title: Romania’s Government Survives No-Confidence Vote Over Austerity

author: Erik Wasson, David Gura
description: The ink is hardly dry on President Donald Trump’s $3.4 trillion tax and spending package and House Republicans are already at work on a follow-up budget bill coming this autumn.
title: Next Trump Budget Bill Begins Taking Shape in US House

author: Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said the US will send more weapons to Ukraine, signaling his growing impatience as Russia ignores his demands for a ceasefire and steps up its military campaign.
title: Trump Promises More Weapons for Ukraine, Paid for By Europe

author: Daniel Basteiro
description: Spain is taking a major step towards a politically controversial handover of tax-income collection in Catalonia to the regional government.
title: Spain Pledges to Hand Tax Powers to Catalan Regional Government

author: Arne Delfs
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz spent the first weeks of his tenure bolstering Germany’s standing on the global stage, but domestically he’s stumbled, casting doubt on his ability to implement economic reforms.
title: Merz’s Domestic Stumbles Show His Power Base Is Under Strain

author: Andreina Itriago
description: The Colombian senator and presidential hopeful who was shot in the head last month has started neurological rehabilitation at a Bogotá hospital as his condition improves.
title: Colombian Senator Shot in Head Last Month Shows Some Improvement

author: Foster Wong
description: China Vanke Co. said its loss for the first half of 2025 could reach $1.67 billion, underscoring the lingering problems in the nation’s property market.
title: China Vanke Says First Half Net Loss May Rise to $1.67 Billion

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine’s President Volodymyr Zelenskiy said he’ll replace his prime minister as part of a cabinet overhaul as his government seeks to boost weapons production and maintain US support in its war against Russia.
title: Zelenskiy Swaps Prime Minister Role in Government Overhaul

author: Ntando Thukwana
description: South Africa expressed confidence that it can get finance ministers and central bank governors from the Group of 20 nations to agree on a communique for the first time since it assumed the leadership of the bloc, despite differences between the US and its other members.
title: South Africa Aims to Forge G-20 Accord Despite Ongoing US Enmity

author: Fola Akinnibi, Rachel Adams-Heard
description: The Trump administration’s $45 billion for detention is raising fresh concerns over law enforcement visits to families.
title: Advocates Fear US Agents Are Using ‘Wellness Checks’ on Children as a Prelude to Arrests

author: Arsalan Shahla
description: Iran and the US haven’t agreed on a time, date or place to resume stalled negotiations over Tehran’s nuclear program, Iran’s Foreign Ministry spokesman said on Monday.
title: Iran Says No Decision Yet on Resumption of US Nuclear Talks

author: Anders Melin
description: It’s been eight months since Daim Zainuddin, the business tycoon credited with helping to pull Malaysia out of the Asian Financial Crisis, died and was buried in Kuala Lumpur.
title: Why Does Malaysia Want to Seize $700 Million From a Dead Tycoon?

author: Yash Roy
description: Republican House leaders anticipate passing an industry-friendly stablecoin regulatory bill this week, sending Congress’s first major digital assets legislation to the president and kicking off a series of votes on related measures that supporters have dubbed “Crypto Week.”
title: Stablecoin Bill Poised to Pass as House Kicks Off ‘Crypto Week’

author: Suzanne Lynch
description: The 27-nation bloc has trade heft and a series of counter-measures it can deploy, if pushed too far.
title: Brussels Is Getting Anxious at Trump’s EU Tariff Threats

author: Michal Kubala, Jorge Valero
description: Donald Trump’s proposed 30% tariff on European Union goods is “effectively prohibitive” to transatlantic trade and could warrant retaliation, the bloc’s chief negotiator said.
title: EU Warns Trump’s Tariff Threat Is Danger to Transatlantic Trade

author: Michelle Ma
description: From coal-fired power to a risky bet to cool the planet, these are the sectors likely to get a boost.
title: Trump’s Tax Law Throws Lifeline to Unloved Energy and Climate Sectors

author: Sakura Murakami
description: US President Donald Trump attacked the car trade imbalance between the US and Japan again on Sunday, days ahead of a scheduled visit by Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent to the Asian country that could apply further pressure to the minority government.
title: Trump Criticizes Japanese Cars Again Ahead of Bessent Visit

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen, Jing Li
description: India’s foreign minister said ties with Beijing have been stabilizing in recent months, as he visits China for the first time since the deadly border clashes between the two Asian neighbors in 2020.
title: India’s Foreign Minister Sees Progress in China Ties on First Visit Since 2020

author: James Mayger
description: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese traveled to China determined to focus on trade and jobs, but navigating the tensions between the US and China, particularly over security flashpoints like Taiwan, will loom over this trip all week.
title: Australia’s Leader Walks Fine Line Between Xi and Trump in China

author: Antony Sguazzin
description: For the second time this year, the world’s most powerful finance ministers gather in South Africa without the presence of the US Treasury Secretary.
title: G-20 Agenda Eclipsed as Bessent Skips South Africa Meeting Again

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra may seek more time to submit a defense statement in an alleged ethical violation case being probed by a top court.
title: Thai PM May Seek More Time to File Court Response in Ethics Case

author: Toru Fujioka, Sumio Ito
description: Bank of Japan officials are likely to consider raising at least one of their inflation forecasts at a policy meeting later this month, after rice and food-related prices rose more than expected, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: BOJ Is Said Likely to Consider Raising Inflation Forecast

author: Swati Pandey
description: Australia opposes any unilateral moves to change the Taiwan Strait status quo, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said as he began a trip to China to maintain steady ties with his country’s top trading partner.
title: Albanese Reaffirms Taiwan Stance as He Starts China Visit

author: Heesu Lee
description: North Korea has continued to supply millions of artillery shells and other munitions to Russia since the start of Moscow’s war in Ukraine, according to military data submitted to a South Korean lawmaker.
title: North Korea Supplies Russia With 12 Million Shells, Seoul Says

author: Ram Anand
description: Malaysia will require permits for exports and transshipments of high-performance US artificial intelligence chips, suggesting the government is seeking to clamp down on the diversion of the sensitive components to places like China.
title: Malaysia to Require Permits on Trade of High-End US AI Chips

author: Josh Xiao, James Mayger, Philip Glamann, Yujing Liu
description: China’s export growth accelerated for the first time since March, driven by a reduction in US tariffs and robust demand from key overseas markets.
title: China’s Export Growth Picks Up as Fragile Trade Ceasefire Holds

author: Toru Fujioka
description: The Bank of Japan finished selling millions of dollars of stocks it bought from besieged banks during a domestic banking crisis in the early 2000s and the later Lehman Shock, ending a nearly two decade process and bringing closer market attention to the fate of its much bigger pile of exchange-traded funds.
title: BOJ Finishes Offloading Bank Stocks, Bringing Attention to ETFs
